comment.body:
Ha, interesting. Zeronet seems a little unstable still. It generally works just fine, but sometimes strange stuff happens :)
Considering how well it works, and how much progress has been made in such a short time, I'm sure that it will continue to improve.
I often watch PyCon videos, and some of my favorite speakers do this (David Beazley, for example). It's quite interesting and informative to watch, but you have to be fast enough to keep the pace up!
Hi Arsene, I've tried to use Antilibrary, but The book lists always show empty. I've added databases, but the search always turns up empty. Any ideas?

A bit late, but I'd vote for changing to GPLv3. The anti-tivoization changes are a welcome change. Switching from GPLv2 to v3 is fairly straightforward, unlike if you were switching the license entirely.
Good luck! Make sure to post back again when the video is available for viewing.
I've been thinking about this as well. It seems like a good match.
